vacuum.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a space that is completely empty of all gas, especially one from which all the air has been taken away
vacuum.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a situation in which someone or something is missing or lacking
vacuum.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Her husband’s death left a vacuum in her life.
the political vacuum caused by the ban on Communist Party activity
vacuum.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: – Meaning 3: a situation in which someone or something is missing or lacking
vacuum.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: His sudden departure created a vacuum at the head of the company.
The disappearance of religious beliefs has left a vacuum in many people's lives.
What political ideas have filled the vacuum left by the fall of communism?
The leader's sudden death created a power vacuum.
Military leaders stepped in to fill the political vacuum.
Many children are growing up in a moral vacuum.
There is a policy vacuum on climate change.
vacuum.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to clean using a vacuum cleaner
